txt.en:
'Though the Dragon-clan has long been known to war with even their own countrymen, I fear this company is not here to stir trouble in Dunland. There have been Dunlending travellers going to and fro between Pren Gwydh and Tâl Methedras, and the Draig-lûth have ignored them.

'Perhaps one of them carries orders from their chieftain, or a general of their forces -- if there are such ranks among these wild men. Would you enter their camp, Uvel-cadlus, and seek such orders among their captains?

'It will be dangerous, but such information can only benefit our cause.'

'Indeed, this is as I feared. These orders are directing the Dragon-clan to join with a company from the Ox-clan at the Mustering Tree, from where they will march south to Wulf's Cleft.\n\n'This is troubling, but useful information.'
'Cut the head from the Dragon, and the beast will perish...I am sure of it.'
A company of Dragon-clan warriors is encamped at the northern end of the Gravenwood, marching down from Enedwaith.
One of the Dunlending captains might carry the orders Thurbald seeks.\n\nThurbald has asked you to find a copy of the Draig-lûth's orders.
Thurbald is hiding to the south of Uvel-cadlus.\n\nYou should bring the orders you found to Thurbald at once.
